ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Routed_printed_component is a type of included where the explicit layout pattern is a design property and where the requirements are consistent along a path. The terminals are inherited from .
the component_extent specifies the role of the for the Routed_printed_component.

A Printed_component is a type of . A Printed_component may be a or a or a . A Printed_component is an occurrence of that is used as an in an . A Printed_component is manufactured integral to an . Only the Routed_printed_component subtype shall reference a as a usage_definition.
and are provided for the most common case of CAD system interface requirements. Printed_component other than Printed_connector are generally reserved for more complex requirements.

the cad_layer specifies the for the Printed_component. The cad_layer is optional and need not be supplied.
The cad_layer is only appropriate where there is a single layer material being defined.

the associated_subsequent_link is an inverse relationship that specifies that the Printed_component is existent dependent on the for which the Printed_component is in the role of subsequent_printed_component. There may be zero or one member of in this role. The link provides a mechanism to instantiate complex vertical structures found in advanced CAD systems using Printed_component as the elements.

the associated_precedent_link is an inverse relationship that specifies that the Printed_component is existent dependent on the for which the Printed_component is in the role of precedent_printed_component. There may be zero or one member of in this role. The link provides a mechanism to instantiate complex vertical structures found in advanced CAD systems using Printed_component as the elements.
the raw_access_mechanism is an inverse relationship that specifies the existence dependency of the Printed_component on the that specifies the Printed_component as its .

the access_mechanism is a derived relationship that specifies the role of the that specifies the Printed_component as its and the that specify members of Printed_component that are in the printed_component_stack.

the footprint_implementation specifies the that helps implement part or all of the geometric features for the Printed_component.
It is expected that implementation experience will determine the cases where footprint_implementation is needed to implement the material shapes of a Printed_component. Initial cases indicate it is one of four mutually exclusive options, but in the case of paste components there may be need of footprint occurrence for the adjacent layer metalization. It may be more appropriate to use for the paste component terminal adjacent layer metalization since that may be referenced by a terminal.

the required_material_stack specifies the role of the for the Printed_component. A required_material_stack is provided for the case where one geometric shape is used for multiple strata of the product.
A Gold plated Edge connector requires several layers of metalization in addition to the copper design layer. The requirement that the same geometry is used to process the additional layers is represented by including a required_material_stack in the exchange.

the printed_component_stack specifies the role of a for the Printed_component. The printed_component_stack specifies the vertical arrangement of the printed component as consisting of a sequence of Printed_component.

the stratum_feature_implementation specifies the for the Printed_component. There shall be one or more for a Printed_component.
A microwave filter may use discontiguous materials on the same stratum to embody the functionality of the filter. This requires several Stratum_features for one Printed_component even though the component is entirely on one layer.

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
A Printed_component_join_terminal is a type of . This terminal is a terminus for internal circuitry in the interconnect substrate.
Figure illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows the internal terminals of the printed connector (edge connector).
the stratum_concept_implementation_component specifies either the , the , the , the , or the for the Printed_component_join_terminal.
the associated_component specifies the being accessed by the Printed_component_join_terminal.
the definition specifies the that defines the Printed_component_join_terminal.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Printed_connector_component is a type of . The Printed_connector_component is the occurrence of a . The purpose of the Printed_connector_component is to provide access to the assembly in which the interconnect substrate, that the realized connector is part of, is installed.

the interface_access_mechanism is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_connector_component is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Printed_connector_component as its . There shall be one or more for a Printed_connector_component.

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
A Printed_connector_component_interface_terminal is a type of . The Printed_connector_component_interface_terminal is an individual access mechanism (e.g., one terminal on a ). "Interface" means it is not tied to the substrate as part of the fabrication or assembly operation.
the associated_component specifies the role of the for the Printed_connector_component_interface_terminal.
the definition specifies the role of the for the Printed_connector_component_interface_terminal.
